com.strandgenomics.imaging.icore
Interface IRecord

All Superinterfaces:
Disposable
All Known Implementing Classes:
com.strandgenomics.imaging.icore.bioformats.BioRecord, RawRecord, Record
public interface IRecord
extends Disposable

Record is a collection of images possibly specified in six dimensions (x,y,z,time,site,channel) and associated with a single acquisition instance

Author:
arunabha

 int getFrameCount()
          Returns the maximum number of frames (time samples) associated with this record
 int getImageCount()
          Returns the total number of images represented by this record
 int getImageHeight()
          Returns the height (in pixels) of the images represented by this record Note that height is same for all images within the record
 ImageType getImageType()
          image type - a fixed set of values (Grayscale, RGB32, etc.) - default is Grayscale if no images are present, otherwise it is inferred from the data
 int getImageWidth()
          Returns the width (in pixels) of the images represented by this record Note that width is same for all images within the record
 String getOriginMachineAddress()
          Returns the MAC address - A Media Access Control address - (ethernet card) - network hardware address of the acquisition computer Note: more that one network interface may be associated with the computer, we may need to pick the first one after sorting
 String getOriginMachineIP()
          Returns the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the acquisition computer
 IPixelDataOverlay getOverlayedPixelData(int sliceNo, int frameNo, int siteNo, int[] channelNos)
          Returns the combined pixel data of the specified dimensions

          Returns the containing project for this record
 IPixelData getPixelData(Dimension d)
          Returns the image handler associated with the specified coordinates Note that slice (and frame) numbers are 1 based numbering and it is illegal to provide a number which greater than what getSliceCount (getFrameCount) returns
 PixelDepth getPixelDepth()
          Returns the Quality of the images (one of 32/16/8 bit images)

          Pixels are small square dots on the computer screen/image Returns the physical length represented by a pixel along the x-axis

          Returns the physical length represented by a pixel along the z-axis

          Each record has a unique signature or finger print.

getSignature

Signature getSignature()
Each record has a unique signature or finger print. This method returns the signature associated with this record. Signature is typically the md5 hash of the data represented by the fixed field plus one representative image within the record (say the one with center coordinates)

Returns:
md5 sum of the record
Throws:
IOException

getOriginMachineAddress

String getOriginMachineAddress()
Returns the MAC address - A Media Access Control address - (ethernet card) - network hardware address of the acquisition computer Note: more that one network interface may be associated with the computer, we may need to pick the first one after sorting

Returns:
mac address of the machine from which record is uploaded

addUserAnnotation

void addUserAnnotation(Map<String,Object> annotations)

getPixelData

IPixelData getPixelData(Dimension d)
                        throws IOException
Returns the image handler associated with the specified coordinates Note that slice (and frame) numbers are 1 based numbering and it is illegal to provide a number which greater than what getSliceCount (getFrameCount) returns

Parameters:
specified - dimension(t,z,c,site)
Returns:
corresponding pixel data
Throws:
IOException

                       int channelNo,
                       VisualContrast contrast)

Parameters:
channelNo - specified channel no

                                 int channelNo)

Parameters:
zStacked - true if contrast of Z Stacked image is desired
channelNo - specified channel
Returns:
the custom contrast, if any, for all images of this record, otherwise null

getChannelOverlayImagesForSlices

List<BufferedImage> getChannelOverlayImagesForSlices(int frameNo,
                                                     int siteNo,
                                                     int imageWidth,
                                                     boolean useChannelColor)
                                                     throws IOException
fetches the overlaid on all channels (and scaled) images for all slices from the specified frame and site

Parameters:
frameNo - the frame number under consideration
siteNo - the site number under consideration
imageWidth - the required image height (for scaling purpose)
useChannelColor - checks whether to use channel colors
Returns:
list of image all the site in order
Throws:
IOException
